item.title: Custom twitter feed project - Part 1
item.description: Introduction This is an introductory post about the project I’m making. I’m in process of reading Machine Learning Bookcamp Book by Alexey Grigorev . The main “meta” concept behind this book is the idea, that the best way to learn Machine Learning is by doing projects. In parallel, I follow Applied ML course by Goku Mohandas . I will try to incorporate things I learn from both of those sources while doing this project.

item.title: How to research stuff using Twitter
item.description: Key to this method - follow lots of opinionated people. I follow many people - more than 600. There are many ML experts. So if I’m researching what methods to use, what algorithms, or just want to learn about a subject I’ll use Twitter first for that. Using search Let’s say I want to learn how to do “topic modeling” on a dataset made of tweets. I just use search, remembering to check “People you follow”

item.title: How to avoid distractions while using Twitter
